Excellent approach! Watching YouTube tutorials and reading about the USS Iowa's history will definitely help you get a better understanding of the ship's design and features. Scratch-building details can add a whole new level of realism to your model. Here are some additional tips to consider when scratch-building armament and deck equipment:

**Armament**

1. Research the correct armament: Verify the type and configuration of guns, turrets, and mounts used on the USS Iowa during the time period you're modeling.
2. Use reference images: Collect reference images of the armament from various angles to ensure accuracy in your scratch-built parts.
3. Choose the right materials: Select materials that can be shaped and detailed to mimic the real armament, such as styrene, resin, or metal.
4. Add details last: Add details like gun barrels, breach mechanisms, and sights last, using a combination of scratch-built and kit parts.

**Deck Equipment**

1. Identify the equipment: Research the types of deck equipment used on the USS Iowa, such as cranes, winches, and anchors.
2. Use reference images: Collect reference images of the deck equipment from various angles to ensure accuracy in your scratch-built parts.
3. Simplify complex shapes: Break down complex shapes into simpler components, making it easier to scratch-build and assemble.
4. Add functional details: Add functional details like hinges, pulleys, and cables to give your scratch-built deck equipment a more realistic look.

**General Scratch-Building Tips**

1. Plan ahead: Plan your scratch-built parts carefully, considering the materials, tools, and techniques required.
2. Use a variety of materials: Don't be afraid to mix and match materials to achieve the desired look and texture.
3. Add textures and details: Add textures and details to your scratch-built parts to give them a more realistic appearance.
4. Practice and iterate: Don't be discouraged if your first attempts don't turn out as expected. Practice, and iterate on your designs until you achieve the desired result.

**Additional Resources**

1. Naval model building books: Consult books on naval model building, such as "The Ship Model Builder's Handbook" or "Naval Modeling: A Guide to Building and Detailing Model Warships."
2. Online forums: Join online forums, like ModelWarships.com or The Ship Model Forum, to connect with experienced modelers and learn from their experiences.
3. Scratch-building tutorials: Watch YouTube tutorials or online guides on scratch-building techniques, such as those by Mig Jimenez or The Modeling Community.

By following these tips and resources, you'll be well on your way to creating a stunning USS Iowa model with impressive scratch-built details. Good luck, and have fun!
